intro: Ottonia schwackeae, commonly known as the Schwacke's ottonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
